summary: With over 13,000 workouts, how you choose to Sweat is up to you.

scraped_reviews.content: I have had the sweat app since 2019 and although I don't always stick to it, I think it is a great deal considering the cost of a gym membership. I do wish there was a feature that would allow all program workouts to have a shorter ~20 minute version. The biggest obstacle for me sticking to the programs is the time commitment. most workouts take 45min - 1hr to complete from warmup to cool down. I think shorter workouts would reduce the barrier to entry for so many people.

You get an app use either for $134.99 a year with no trial at a savings of 55% charged at once or you get the trial period of 7 days and a monthly charge. I'm going with neither of these options( a trial period would have been nice though, before plunging into a FULL charge of $134.99 per year) and picking another app with better choices! Thank you, Erin :-)

I used this app back in 2019 and purchased the subscription again this year after 5 years of being away. It is surprising to me that even after 5 years the bugs are still the same! You could still not sync the app with your ANDROID watch which means to see your daily steps on the app you need to take extra step and download a 3rd party app. Second, when it is on "WALK" workout you need to stay on the timer screenØŒif the screen turns black for Battery usageØŒ it stops counting steps & time

I've worked with a personal trainer on and off for 4 yrs now and I usually do my own thing during the off moments. Thought i'd give this a try even though i've been skeptical of apps... the PWR is great! It's just like having her right there. The timers, the workouts, keeping track of your progress and what's left. I just use it for workouts but the recipes look really good, too
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for your support!! Weâ€™re so glad to hear youâ€™re enjoying the SWEAT app!

scraped_reviews.content: I've used the app for a month so far and I love it. The only thing I would change would being able to track the amount of weight used & to be able to skip around in the workouts. Once you start, you have to do the workout in order and sometimes the equipment isnt available to do so. I'm currently doing PWR and I love it. I do wish there were modification options to some of the exercises (leg press?!). Also the new update has made it difficult to hear the trainer cues. Overall it's worth the $$!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Lauren, Thanks so much for your feedback and will take this into consideration as we continue to update the Sweat app. With the new Spotify integration the trainer audio is controlled via a seperate channel (this will most likely be in notification volume control) You will be able to increase the volume here : )

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using this app for the past 3 years and I love it! I appreciate the amount of user feedback they incorporate into regular updates. I still find that the app crashes fairly regularly (about 1/5 uses) but it's not a huge deal. One thing I would love to see.. with the new weight tracking for each exercise is that the weights would automatically populate the next time you do that specific exercise so you could know where to start with pyramids etc. I refer to a notes doc to check this.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for your support and feedback Taylor, we are sorry to hear you are experiencing crashes with your Sweat App! We would love to look into this further for you, could you please reach out to us at support@sweat.com? ðŸ˜Š

scraped_reviews.content: This app is amazing. When you purchase a subscription you gain access to a half dozen different training and a number of different workout programs and styles. There are also multiple home workout options. Buying the yearly subscription is excellent value, given all the options. I also love that there are rigorous programs, which tell you exactly what to do depending on your goals. All you have to do is open the app and do what it says.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for your support!! Weâ€™re so glad to hear youâ€™re enjoying the Sweat app! All the best with your training ðŸ’ªðŸ»

scraped_reviews.content: Great app bad customer service. Okay, love the app. I have been using it for at least 2 years. My beef is with their customer service. There is no direct number to call to speak to a rep about managing your account subscription. I have tried many, many, many times to email them about cancelling my subscription form apple pay to Google pay to no avail because I no longer have an Apple account/phone. I'm so sick of trying to explain why i can't do it and still they refuse to listen to my problem.

Review for Android users: when the app works, it's great. However I've had multiple instances where the app just will not open for whatever reason for days at a time. Not because of an update and this isn't because of my phone. Super frustrating when you have to opt out for other workouts for days at a time until the app decides to work again. Installing and reinstalling the app doesn't help at all either. I've reached out to support and they don't really help/have answers.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: To ensure your app runs as smoothly as possible, please ensure you are running the latest operating system for your device, and your Sweat app is on the latest version. If you experience any issues after updating, please contact our support team for further assistance.

scraped_reviews.content: This app has been extremely helpful with being consistent with exercise. I'm often on a regular program so it has set workouts each week, varying in difficulty. I love that I can also choose express workouts or one from another program depending on where I am, or what equipment I have on hand. Each exercise has a detailed description of how to complete it. I also like that I can log workouts, and I now use the app as a sort of health tracker to hold myself accountable. Highly recommend!

EDIT: I have now been using this app for over a year and I really enjoy it. It's the best app I've used by far. ---- I have been following the BUILD program using the Sweat Wpp. The app is great although I'm not sure if it's different for other programs. There are multiple programs to choose from, different types of exercise programs and individual exercises. They have written and video examples. I have made major gains using the BUILD Program.

Love this App. I was looking for one on nutrition and came across this app. Let me tell you it has helped me loose 10 ibs in 3 weeks. Amazing support and trainers. You choose a program that works for you. My first trainer wasn't my style and after a week I knew I had to change. So I found a trainer for my taste. Either way they make it easier on you to find what you need. Ohh and the meals amazing ideas. It serves 1 but double and you serve 2. There are apps to help count the fats and caleries.

I love this app and the trainers. I have been using it for almost four years. It would be AWESOME if you could make it so that if you forget to say you completed a workout one day you can still go back and say "completed on this day". Right now you are limited to only adding workouts to the in app calendar on the current day. So for example, if I completed LISS on Wednesday but forgot to add it, I can't go back and say I did it on Wednesday. PLEASE fix this it has been bugging me forever!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Isabel, thanks for your review! That is amazing, thank you so much for your support! This is currently a feature we are looking into thanks to feedback received from our community! Stay tuned ðŸ™‚

scraped_reviews.content: I really enjoy this app and have been using it for the past 3 months. I do wish there was example of modifications for people who cannot do certain types of exercises. I also agree about the food planning and recommendations being unhelpful and ridiculous. I wish there were better options and more reasonable meals. Other than that I love the app, but I think for $20 a month, there should be way more options.

The app allows you to follow only one official program at once. Granted you can add in a limited number of workouts from other programs from "on demand" but you can follow only one complete program at a time. I would like to be able to follow more than one complete 12 week program... for instance the PWR AND Yoga. And I would like to be able to save recipes! Some are realllly good and you can *star them but you still have to search for them each time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review and feedback Lisa :) These are features we are currently working to develop and improve on in the future!

scraped_reviews.content: Pretty good! I like all the workouts but it'll freeze occasionally and I have to uninstall and reinstall to get it to work again. Also, I really wish I could backlog workouts if I forget to document it. I'd like if we could pick low or high intensity workout. Sometimes I have hard days at work and I'm tired or if it's late and I live on the top floor apartment it'd be nice to choose. And opposite, if I'm high energy one day and can withstand something more intense, it'd be nice to choose.

Love the workouts! This app has helped me so much to improve my fitness. My only complaint is that I can't connect my fitbit to it to track my steps. I wish they would let you use a fitbit instead of only allowing Google Fit. Otherwise, I have no complaints, I've lost 20 lbs with the help of this app and improving my diet. The hiit workouts are great and I've noticed such a change in physique and muscle gain and haven't had to "lift heavy" to do so. I've mostly done it all with 15 lb dumbbells!

This app has potential but I feel it alienates some groups by lacking more detailed search options. It would be nice to see previews is the programs and what types of workouts are included. I have a foot injury and need to sub for low-impact. Unfortunately, there's no way to know what's in the programs until you start one. You also can't adjust program start dates. The app assumes Sunday as a rest day when Sundays are my longest workout days.

I love this app. I have been using different programs over the past few months and have gone from being a relative couch potato to looking forward to work out. I also use the on demand section to schedule other types of workouts than the program I am currently on. I don't really use the food section because a lot of the ingredients are not in my grocery store and I don't want to cook a totally different meal for every single meal. My only complaint is that you cannot connect to Garmin yet.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Amazing review! Weâ€™re so happy to welcome you to the Sweat community!Your feedback is very valuable to us, we explore all suggestions that are provided to us as we continue to update the Sweat app.

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using this app for about six years (back when it had a less socially acceptable name), and it's really great. I've bounced between gym classes, small group training and personal training, and I keep coming back to the app because it's so affordable and the workout routines are great. I use the on demand workouts whenever I have less time or dont have access to a gym. 100% worth it.

I think this app is great for people who have little workout experience or dont feel comfortable working out at a gym. I personally have a lot of experience in the gym and am in pretty decent shape - for me and people similar, it's not the best. I originally signed up because I'm in medical school and dont have time to write my own workouts, so this took the stress off for me, however, some of the workouts are a bit too easy even if I lift my heaviest (I end up modifying the workouts sometimes to make them tougher). I also dont like that there is only 1 leg day and 2 upper body days. For my body type I need a lot of legs - at least 2 times a week, so I have to add in my own workouts for the results I wanna see. But for beginners and people just starting out - go for it.

This app is low quality, and very limited. The workouts are basic, and a bit boring. My steps do not connect so every day it says I've taken 0000 steps when I live a very active lifestyle. It does not pick up on a working you are doing and while it has a way to add a workout manually it won't be able to "calculate" this into your progress. The app is very basic, there is little to no coaching on form, no coach interaction, and repetitive workouts. For how expensive the app is, I am disappointed

$20 a month is like the price of a single yoga class. And you get 12 dozens of weekly workouts, a robust tracking app, plus a community of like-minded ladies. It's been instrumental in staying fit the busier I get. At this point, I know I can commit to the annual subscription (which is even more affordable than the monthly plan). Love this app!

Good But Too Expensive I enjoyed the workouts and convenience of the app but just couldn't justify spending twice the cost of my gym. I would rather choose 1 program and pay $20 per YEAR. The meal plans is too difficult to be useful. Every meal of every day was a different recipe with no week-long meal prep option. If this was the only fitness item a person paid for then it might be worth it. For people that go to a gym and other active classes its too much. Also, too many ads for the $.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review Mandy! Based on member feedback, our team are working hard on improvements to the meal plan. We believe Sweat offers great value for money with 8 amazing training programs available to complete at home or in the gym, healthy meal plans, education, motivation and the most supportive female fitness community in the world!

scraped_reviews.content: I think this app is the best I've seen so far. It's user friendly and it totally is like having a personal trainer in you phone. They keep adding programs and trainers so there's something for everybody Now, it seems most of the programs rely on timed exercises, which I hate, it's really hard to get in position for the next exercise, 3 or 5 seconds it definitely not enough. I would really like they had more program with JUST repetition exercises, but overall, the app it's really great.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for your support Mariely!! We would love to hear from you on our Suggestions page of the community forum: https://forum.sweat.com/ with any ways we can continue to improve your experience :)

scraped_reviews.content: I LOVE this app! first started out a few years ago with the ebooks, which were challenging but great. I've had this app for about 6 months now and I absolutely love it. It keeps me accountable and there are SO many options for work out programs. dont be scared by the price, it is worth every penny. I have a work out plan and also access to so many meal plans! this app is amazing and I'm so grateful for the trainers that put in all the time & effort for us!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Amazing review Kayla! Thank you for your continued support :)

scraped_reviews.content: I really like the workouts and the layout so I decided to pay the $20. However, this application only records things when it wants too. I have imput all the information to detail (weights/rpe and equipment) just for it to get deleted and I keep getting the message " no history you haven't done this exercise" even when the exercise is marked as completed. No reply to emails, no support. App is clearly cheap made and they charge that much - not to mention the spam emails. I'm requesting a refund.

this app is great to cover a good quick workout. If you're looking for something that involves a bunch of cardio this isn't for you. you can build in cardio but this app is primarily for a quick 28 minute work out focused on arms, legs and abs. Just like the name of the app, you will sweat and is aimed at all abilities. would highly recommend.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review Lisa! Thatâ€™s great to hear :)

scraped_reviews.content: Great app, excellent work out, there's only a couple of things I'd change. First off, I LOVE the gif videos showing proper form of movement and the written explanation of the how to do it. The audio cues for moving to the next step is amazing, and I love being able to connect to Spotify. However, if you move away from the app on your rest, the timer doesn't sound off. Also, when recording the weights you've used, it doesn't populate the weight based on what you did last time. But I recommend it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review and feedback, Emma! The team is now working on the next phase of weight tracking as we speak. You will soon be provided with more visibility on the weights you have logged in previous workouts, with the ability to access your weight logging data for each of your exercises prior to and during your workouts. Stay tuned! ðŸ˜Š

scraped_reviews.content: This app has a lot of great information (workouts, recovery, food) but it has some shortcomings in terms of user customization. Specifically, I would like to set my week start day to something other than a Monday. It would also be useful to have a single vibrate or tone notification when the time for an exercise/stretch has ended. It is difficult to look at your phone when holding streches to see when its time to move on to the other side or new stretch.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We greatly appreciate your feedback and will take this into consideration as we continue to update the Sweat app :)

scraped_reviews.content: This is an excellent app. One of my favorite things about it is how transparent they are. I was on a trial period for 3 months that was going to expire soon and instead of sneaking the $20 a month program on me they sent me multiple reminders to either stop the program or change my subscription. It was also super easy to cancel my subscription any time, which I only did so I could subscribe again for 6 months! I love all the different options for workouts at home and at the gym!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for your support Elizabeth! Weâ€™re so glad to hear youâ€™re enjoying the Sweat app!

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using Sweat for 4 weeks. I had to restart my first week twice but now I'm hooked and I do my workout every day, except the rest days obviously. I already feel stronger and more confident in my ability. The programs absolutely work. I love it. The app is really easy to use, I love the verbal announcement when changing exercises. The animations are good too. There seems to be a weird bug with the Spotify integration where it will get stuck playing the same few songs during my workout.

After a year of using the app I think it is incredibly well done. I do find the beginner workouts too challenging as I start again after a long break.. but as long as I modify and do something similar during the allotted time/reps, strength soon follows. The food section would be more helpful if it didn't have a different recipe for every meal, every day, if there was room for leftovers, and if recipes had some overlapping ingredients. So I don't use the food section at all. Overall ðŸ¤©

This app is really well done. There are so many trainers, exercise styles, and alternatives to choose from. I love that it has home (with no equipment) and gym options, so you can use it anywhere! The scheduling calendar is a bit "meh" and I wish it would sync to my Fitbit. Other than that, it's a great app and I've gotten great results from it!

two stars bc it's not user friendly. It also tells me I've completed an exercise when i haven't and there is no way to undo it. i wish i could give it 2.5 stars though because when you are actually able to do one of the exercises, you really sweat. The exercises are definitely on point. Also, it doesn't let you change the day you did an exercise, isn't linked to other fitness apps i.e. fitbit, and no music. alarm doesn't sound at end of exercise either. $20/month should allow for such things.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We greatly appreciate your feedback Michelle and will take this into consideration as we continue to update the Sweat app :)

scraped_reviews.content: I love the workouts, the recovery and all of the support. I do like that they give you meal plans and a shopping list, but I'd really like an option for meal prepping a few days at a time with a list. My biggest issue is when I click out of the app during a workout it pauses my time. I clicked into a music app to change my music and Sweat paused my time, so I worked out for 15 minutes unrecorded.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review Kayla! Based on member feedback, our team are working hard on improvements to the meal plan. Please ensure you have 'Background App Refresh' enabled for the Sweat app, to ensure it will continue when clicking out of the app :) If you're still experiencing issues please feel free to reach out via support.sweat.com :)

scraped_reviews.content: So far, so good! You can choose from video workouts to follow along or pre-created ones where they just give you instructions for each circuit. I loved the latter because I could go at my own pace. There were video and written instructions for each move, and the option to log your weights to keep track of progression. Updated 3/1/23: I love this app and use it every time I work out. I've gotten so much stronger with it!

Loved the app... then they updated it! I don't like the new way you preview the days workouts now. It was so much easier when it was all on one page and you only had to scroll down to see what the workout entailed. Now you have to scroll down and left/right just to see what the schedule is. And they added an extra picture for the rest periods which totally wasn't necessary. Please put it back! Or at least give me the option to view it the old way.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are sorry to hear your thoughts about the new update. We appreciate your feedback and will ensure to take it into consideration for future updates.

scraped_reviews.content: This app is cumbersome and has many functional flaws. If you forget to log a workout you cannot add it to your calendar later, you can't add notes or explanations about a workout anywhere, you can't even access the content unless you have an Internet connection, and there isn't an option to download a workout to use offline. Some of the workouts are missing basic instructions like telling you to alternate sides or when to switch. The workouts are just ok - very repetitive. Poor value for $20/mo.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Appreciate the feedback!

scraped_reviews.content: Exercises were great, UX was clunky but easy to use. Unfortunately I gave up after 3 weeks because I'm lazy, but my favorite part was how EASY they made it to cancel my subscription. It sounds like a strange reason to rate an app, but it's so common to make your cancellation experience difficult. All I had to do was go to my profile and hit cancel. I was told I could use the rest of my pre-paid month, and immediately got an email that my cancellation went thru. I will reuse again when I'm ready.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review Taylor! Thatâ€™s great to hear :)

scraped_reviews.content: Really enjoying the PWR workouts & the over all layout of the app. I think it could be cheaper, most people are having to pay the $20 subscription + gym membership fees. There needs to be a count down in the last 3 seconds of the timer! I feel Sweat is very biased towards apple. Wondering when it will work with an android watch. Would also be convenient to be able to control the app from the lock screen. Go to the next exercise or see the timer instead of constantly having to check the phone.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review! Your feedback is very valuable to us and we take all suggestions onboard as we work on upcoming updates.

scraped_reviews.content: Love the workout plans, but the meal plans lack any nutritional information and are way too random! I should not have a shopping list 107 items long that includes things like "3/4 of a sweet potato" for 1 week of meals. you can have plenty of variety with half that many ingredients. Also, HAVE YOU NOTICED THE PANDEMIC? I'm not going to be in a grocery store long enough to buy over 100 individual items! Slightly frustrating that you can't scheduled workouts more than 1 week in advance

Love this app! Have been using it for over a year and got amazing results from it! Everytime there is an update, it is better than before! Love that there are so many different trainers with different styles to choose from and that you can still use the other programs on days you want to change things up. Only thing I would like is if you were able to record ALL weight amounts, adjust reps or sets if necessary, & to be able to look back at what they were on following weeks.

I love this app. I've been using it since 2018. The only complaint that I have is that when doing the Pilates program, when switching, from left to right in some parts, it doesn't say to switch, I end up working out one side, and then it switches to the next session then I have to go back.When resting, it would be nice that it would say what equipment to use for the next session. Usually, I'm rushing to put on the band and pause the session or rewind it. Hopefully, this could be fixed.

These workouts will kick. your. ass. into shape. For me, this is definitely worth the money because if I have something put into it, I'll be more motivated to get everything out of it that I can by sticking with the workouts. My one criterique is that I can't link the Sweat app to the Fitbit app, which tracks more accurately than the google fit app that's linked. I haven't gotten into the recipes much, but I'm excited to check those out.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We greatly appreciate your feedback Jamie and will take this into consideration as we continue to update the Sweat app :)

scraped_reviews.content: Extremely disappointed. They may offer a 1 week free trial, but you still have to put in your credit card info before you can even see whats in the app. Why would i ever give away my credit card when i have no idea what im getting in return?!?! Like really?!! Seriously? Obvious scam. The Fit52 app is under half the price of this ($3.99-$7.99/month) and offers more than this app offers, with a 3 week free trail and no credit card required until your 3 weeks is up.

signed up for 7 day free trail, only worked for one day, tryed using the app other days in that week it never worked also took forever to load. gave up waiting on for it to load any workouts. never tried using it again till I ended my subscription the day BEFORE trial ended.. which took very long. But concerned because I got a message saying that I will be charged 19.99 on phone bill! I don't understand why, I cancelled my sub. didn't use it, and the price is very high .. for it be not worth it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We would love to look into this for you Laura! Please reach out to our Support Team via our support page, www.sweat.com/support.

scraped_reviews.content: Despite what the app admins say, it's very disappointing to see that a form of payment is even needed for a free 7-day trial. What they should do also or instead is have an option that has a limit to what programs are visible and not accessible until after you sign up for a membership. What it looks like they are preying on with this current tactic is that you'll forget to cancel right away and bam instant hit. This isn't friendly.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: The 7 day free trial does not cost anything in order to join. However, to access the content or continue to use the SWEAT app after this free trial period a subscription is needed which is why the app will ask for payment information. This is something that is stated within the sign up terms.

scraped_reviews.content: Hi, Love the app! I use it all the time and it makes things a lot easier by just giving me set work outs. I like that there are videos to follow as you go along the work outs in real time. I am a visual learner, so it's nice not having to pause the workout to figure it out in a slow video tutorial like other apps. I also like not having to constantly obsess over what I'm going to work out and what exercises to do that day, it takes a lot of stress and anxiety off of your shoulders.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Keri! Thank you for your review! This was an issue which we were made aware of and can confirm a fix has been implemented! Please let us know if you experience any further issues!

scraped_reviews.content: Love this app! It challenges me to push myself while doing the Kayla Itsines workouts. I've been doing the BBG program on and off since college and since I took the plunge to purchase the app I've been more consistent than ever working out. Only 2 things I wish it had are: 1. Connecting to the Fitbit app. There is a way to connect through google but it would be so easy since I already have a Fitbit to link the two. 2. Less repetitive food for the program, but they do give great dietary options.

title: Apple Music
description:
Apple Music is all about the music, with the highest audio quality; exclusive, in-depth content and unparalleled access to the artists you loveâ€“all ad-free.

â€¢ Get unlimited access to 100 million songs.
â€¢ Listen to personalized new releases and find out about big moments in music, handpicked by our editors.
â€¨â€¢ Go deep with artists you love through exclusive interviews, live performances, and more content only found on Apple Music.
â€¨â€¢ Explore dozens of exclusive radio shows, created by the most iconic names in music, live or on demand.
â€¨â€¢Experience the highest audio quality, from immersive Spatial Audio with Dolby Atmos to the unmatched clarity of Lossless Audio.
â€¨â€¢ Make and share playlists with friends, and collaborate on playlists together.
â€¨â€¢ Control the music together with SharePlay in the car.
â€¢ Download your favorite music and listen offline.
â€¨â€¢ Find your Discovery Station, personalized picks, mixes, and more in Listen Now.
â€¢ Follow and sing along with your favorite music with precise, beat-by-beat lyrics, and share the lines that move you.
â€¢ Enjoy a continuous listening experience with crossfade.
â€¢ Keep the music going with AutoPlay.
â€¨â€¢ Stream your favorite music via Chromecast to your favorite device. 
â€¢ Get personalized new releases and find out about big moments in music, handpicked by our editors.
â€¢ Find something new with hundreds of daily charts for cities and countries worldwide.
â€¢ Listen while on the go with Android Auto.

Availability and features vary by country and region, plan, or device. Subscriptions automatically renew unless they are canceled at least 24 hours prior to the end of the current period. Your account will be charged for renewal within 24 hours prior to the end of the current period. You can manage or cancel your subscriptions in Settings after purchase. Apple Media Services Terms and Conditions can be found at https://www.apple.com/legal/internet-services/itunes/.

Optional App Permission
Notifications: To send push notifications about upcoming releases, new artists, friend activity, and other happenings on Apple Music.
Contacts: To recommend friends you may want to connect with on Apple Music. 
Camera: If you want to create a personal profile on Apple Music to share and connect with others, you can choose to take a profile photo. You can also choose to take a photo to add to your Personal Playlists.
You can use Apple Music even without providing consent to any of the above optional app permissions. However, some features of the service may not be available.

summary: Stream over 100 million songs, all ad-free.

scraped_reviews.content: I really wish my "downloaded" music didn't constantly get frozen in buffering. Every hour or so I have to take out my phone and skip a song that refuses to play. Even if it wasn't downloaded I have great signal most of the time, so it's obviously a problem with their UI/music player. It's been broken for the last five years, so I doubt it'll get fixed any time soon.

This app has been broken for a while. If I choose a song to play or play next, it chooses something completely random that isn't even in my library to play. Its been going on for a while to where it would work about 50% of the time but now its about 25% of the time. unacceptable for a service I'm paying for. Imagine trying to watch a movie on Netflix but every time you click on it, it starts playing some other random movie instead. I havent been able to choose a song, album, or artist for days.

When listening over a Google speaker, if I hit "shuffle" the music stops for a few seconds and removes all songs added to the "pay next" queue which is absolutely infuriating. if I start streaming via voice controls then the app isn't synced with the music playing unless I restart the cast from my phone which is frustrating. It would also be nice to be able to add songs in the queue to play next without having to drag them all the way up.

Abysmal loading times for main menu and playlist syncing. It seems to be slowest when I need it most. Also, can't choose specific songs in playlists. The app is slowly becoming completely unusable. Update: the app keeps "forgetting" my downloads. I have a large playlist of downloaded songs, and it just completely stopped when I drove away from my internet connection. This is, at least, the third time this has happened. Unsubscribed.

I like that I was able to keep all my music when I switched back to android. The biggest problems are the glitches. Adding to the queue always brings up previously played things instead of what I am currently trying to play. It also will skip some songs saying they are unavailable, but they are and won't show some of my library because, but the songs are still available on the platform.

The interface is clean & simple, especially the now playing screen and the lyrics. Sound quality is way ahead Spotify. I switched from Spotify because I didn't like how they spent their profits on weapons contracts instead of artists. But there are some things I miss that could go a long way. I wish I could control playback from other devices, like my macbook or watch. And I can't seem to set Apple Music as my default music player so it defaults to it. It also seems to use a lot more battery.

I have to reset the app by uninstalling it every so often because it will not play songs I try to add to the up next. I has a work around for this where I would add the song to my library which would get it to play and if I didn't like the song I would delete it. I am constantly listening for new music and this prevents me or my car mates from playing different tunes. My work around seems to be non-functioning now ðŸ¥² No ads with paid version.

Songs are not loading, even with cache set at 5GB and 5g data. It's happening on multiple albums, and has only started since upgrading to a Pixel 9 pro, never had an issue on my Pixel 7. The app is also automatically setting to repeat all when it connects to the car. It's very frustrating and I'm glad I still have a CD player in the car because I can still listen to music when the songs won't load

I was on a trial, trying to determine if I wanted to switch from Spotify, and after a day or two, I really wanted it to work out, because this app and the music is really nice. However, there's an issue where you can't play songs with voice commands via Android Auto unless your phone is unlocked, while the whole point of Android Auto is that you don't have to look at your phone while driving. That was a nonstarter. It's been discussed on Reddit and in Apple forums for years, yet there's no fix.

I like having so much music at my fingertips, but the app itself is seriously lacking. It's especially painful to navigate while driving, and if I try to get Android/auto to pull something up while I'm driving, it doesn't work unless the app is running and pulled up with the phone open. Also, when playing song to song, the app fades them together awkwardly, and it's terrible. just give me the two second pause! Hopefully it'll get better but being an Apple product, I have my doubts.

This app is great for listening to music. However, I've been encountering issues while the music is playing to where it'll break throughout. And it's not just one song, it'll be throughout. I don't know if it's connectivity issues or the app itself, but it's been happening pretty often. Another thing that I would like to see is the ability to select all songs at once within a playlist instead of individually. It's time-consuming, just trying to redo a playlist.

60% of the time it works every time. Several times in the past and now Apple Music just stopped working. There were no error messages. Nothing, absolutely nothing, happens when I press "Play" on any of the downloaded songs or aobums or any of the live content. On the positive note, Apple Music Support service is much better. At least it shows "An unexpected error has occurred, please refresh the page." message. Very informative. Are thee "expected errors" too? I am a paying subscriber (so far)

This app is so unstable that it feels like a joke. It crashes constantly and there's a ton of stuttering when scrolling through songs, albums, and playlists. On top of that, there is no trace of a button to download all songs. you have to scroll through and download songs one at a time. It is extremely frustrating and stupid that there is no quicker way to download things, especially when some users have existing libraries on other devices.

App stops playing for no reason. I play an artist, one song goes through, and then nothing plays. It somewhat makes sense when I move away from wifi, but most of the time when it fails to play im just sitting down. Still connected. Music selection is often buggy, too. I open an artist's song list, choose one, and an entirely different song plays. Only reason I'm still here is because Spotify raised the prices on me twice. And if that happens here, I'm out

I get that iTunes is meant for iPhones, but if you're going to make an app for android it should, at the very least, work. I attempted to log into my account, since I left my apple device in another state, but it seem almost impossible to navigate. Pages don't load, amoungst other issues. Very frustrating as I have had a monthly subscrtions for over a year now, which I can no longer access because this app simply doesn't work.

Apple sucks more than any other company I've ever used. Sorry for the day I tried them. I've bought many, many songs that I can't access, simply because I don't want to pay an extra subscription fee for their intrusive, expensive app! They are more frustrating with "support" than any non English speaking app on the market. And much more of a rip off.

Love the app. I enjoy the subscription being able to load any music as I please. Though, when I download a Playlist, it's just taking up storage on my phone for no reason. If I'm out on a drive, and I do not have cell service, I can not play music. Perks of apple on an android. Oh, not to mention, if you pay for the apple subscription.... any past music you have bought even years ago, you can not even play if you decide to cancel your subscription as if you never even owned it. Great, but trash.

I just switched from iPhone to android and still have some music. There are more bugs on android. I may have to cancel my subscription if it doesn't work. Every time that I search a song or artist it says there's a network problem. I check my network. Nothing's wrong. My wife's apple music still works great on Her iPhone 8 plus. But this isn't working. Hopefully they'll fix this or they'll lose a paying customer real quick. Now the app keeps crashing and won't open at all.

I love apple music as a subscription service only! The process of adding music that I already own to my account is excruciatingly annoying and tedious. Even music I have purchased directly from Apple music, turns into such a frustrating ordeal. Whether on my Mac or iPad or Android phone. I don't think it should be this confusing. I have read so many tutorials about adding music to iCloud. Tried to get the devices to all sink up. There is always something going on to hinder those processes.

This app works well when it wants to, but recently, i've been having random crashes, extreme freezing, certain songs not downloading when downloading a long album, and just recently there has been an extremely loud screeching sound that plays as soon as the song ends. But when you go back to the song and skip to the end, it doesn't do it again. It happens very randomly and doesn't do it on any other streaming service and it's not my device/headphones, it seems like an issue on Apples end :/

Cant play a single song and this bug has existed for about a month. I used to be able to use the app, sync songs, update playlists and everything like normal. Suddenly it just stopped working. I deleted and re-installed the app, still can't play any music at all. Really frustrating. I don't even get an error message. Update: this bug has existed for a year. i keep clearing the app memory and re downloading the app. i would give zero stars if i could.

It's been amazing overall in the past. The sound quality is perfect and the catalogue of music is satisfying. The main reason I pay for it is because there are a few songs on it that I love that I can't find on other apps unless I've bought them previously. Lately, especially since the last update in November/December, it's been having issues with playback. Sometimes songs won't load at all; pretty disappointing. That's my only gripe with it.

It great, when it works... Unfortunately, since my phone updated to UI 6.0, it doesn't work at all. It will not load songs, just cycles thru the que, "searching for ever more..." I have restarted my phone, cleared the app cache, and force-stopped and restarted the app, all to no avail. This is the only app I have found that allows me to play what songs I want, when I want, in what order I choose, and to skip songs without penalty. I REALLY want this to start working again.

Downloaded Apple music because I had a free trial on my phone plan. I had been paying YouTube music and enjoyed it very much. So far I'm not impressed. This app is very moody. I have to ask multiple times to download a playlist, and then when it does, it will only download part of the playlist. Recently, when I press the three dots next to a song, instead of pulling up options menu, it will just start the song over. Slow to load and constantly freezing. Same issues it seems.

Good app. But if you're gonna pay a monthly fee, there are some issues. I'll start with the bad. 1st, I tried looking up some songs I have on a free app, and they weren't there. 2nd, during every song, or every other, sounds like the song skips like it's playing from a record. Annoying. Good stuff, great sound quality. Easy to edit Playlist, moving songs in the order you want is very helpful. Nice how they blend the songs together with transition to the next song. No ads, huge plus. Good app.

I usually like apple music pretty well. The radio stations are horrible and I hate when it plays random songs after a playlist is over, but overall the functions of the app are good. However, lately I'm noticing under many artists, not all of their albums are showing up even if the music is actually on there. It also freezes up when I try to add a song up next. Sometimes it doesn't add it at all when it says it did and other times it adds it three times in a row. Please fix these glaring issues!

It's fine, but I don't like how, most of the time, when I choose a song and want similar tracks to play, it has so little relevance. It's a major turn-offðŸ˜•. I'm just waiting for the three-month trial period to complete before deleting this app. Also, it's kind of hard for me to find good new music. But the music options, the categories, and playlists(feeling blue, workout, meditation, 60s music, etc.) are awesome. If the similar music issue wasn't a problem, I would've love this app.

It's a pretty decent app and works very nicely with my android phone. However, it doesn't compare in the slightest with other music streaming apps that are within the same price range. It doesn't automatically make a nice amount of playlists (it only makes a few for you automatically), and even those playlists a lot of times have songs in them that aren't even remotely connected to songs that I have listened to on the app. Another thing is that it would be very useful if it made artist mixes.

I can't believe this is made by apple because it is one of the worst apps I've ever used. It is constantly buggy. For example, sometimes when I add songs to a playlist, it adds the wrong song completely so I have to add songs to my playlists from my computer which isn't always possible. I am disappointed in the quality of the product. *new bug: some songs "aren't available in my country" but I can listen to them on iTunes? It's been very frustrating trying to just listen to my music.

Maybe it works well with other Apple products, definitely not with Samsung. No matter what kind of connection it buffers. If I switch to another song it buffers, even when it's allowed to play on its own it buffers. When I unlock my phone during a song, there's an interruption. The enjoyment is lacking. The platform is not particularly user friendly. No dark mode. The only things I like are being able to see lyrics and videos. Spotify is WAY better.

When I found out I could have apple music on my Android phone I was thrilled! But it hasn't worked out most of the time. It works fine when I search for artists and listen to their music, but my issue is the radio stations. I only listen to the indie, alternative, and rock radio stations. The indie one is the only one that consistently works. The other two will cycle through the same two songs every time I open them without fail. Super annoying and I just end up going back to the only one that works.

I used to love this app, but it stopped actually playing music on 12/24. I have spent the past week uninstalling and reinstalling, as well as trying different things to get it to work. The app opens and loads, allows you to select a song, etc., but it does not play. It just keeps going back to showing the play symbol. I'm really disappointed that I can no longer enjoy my music. *Editing to add that I use it on a Note 9. in case anyone knows of a fix.

The app is very good and beats out amazon music any day. However, I have noticed that whenever I click on a song, it immediately jumps to the next track and it is not pre-downloaded either. It gets annoying having to continously click on the song you want to play without the app jumping to the next track. Some tracks would even have static going on! Also I have noticed that all of the artists and songs I have saved do not show up.

Honestly it's an easy app to use. Everything has been fine till recently. All of a sudden I couldn't reliably alter my library. Sometimes it would work, others it wouldn't and sometimes it half worked. I added an album and all the songs were under the songs section of my library, but not the album. I got library not synced errors and there's no option to manually sync so I was stuck with what I had. Uninstalling and reinstalling seemed to fix it.

Totally broken. When I play a playlist, it plays maybe 3-4 songs then just stops for no reason. Useless. I only got it because it seemed like the easiest way to get my iTunes songs and playlists on to Android. I had mixed results with a DoubleTwist. I guess I'll check that one out again, and look into others. ANYTHING BUT APPLE! (In this and in general.)

I have been using other Music players prior to trying out Apple Music and its not bad. There are definite pros ans cons. Pros: My music automatically syncs to my cars Bluetooth, or at least faster than other music players that require you to have the app open. Smooth design. Has More music choices. Cons: I wish there was an option to add a song you like directly from the notification bar. There is no gapless play option to smoothly transition to the next song.

Works great for being an Apple app on Android. No real issues with offline playback either, unlike some other apps. I've only had it force me to connect twice in nearly a year, others would do that every other day. My only nitpick is that it doesn't keep song titles that are not in English in their native language. Everything gets romanized or translated once its downloaded. It can be a pain for Japanese songs at times, especially for someone who can read the kanji and is expecting to see it.

I've been with Apple Music and seen so many changes. Good for listening individual songs, but dont expect to listen to albums in their entirety - many songs fail to materialise due to licensing issues. Their subscriptions service is a nightmare, unless you're a dedicated Apple follower - turns out that they would rather lose money, than fix an easy subscription base. Anyway, good riddence...I'm happy to listen to the radio or play my music files...that actually play albums in the entirety.

Not a great app. I often have to restart the app because of buffering issues. also, if you listen to an album from a band and want to switch to one of their other albums, rather than clicking back to go to their album page again, it takes you back to the home page. Really annoying, especially if it's a new band and youre not familiar with their albums.

They broke the playlists over a year ago when they removed the custom covers and replaced them with generic, cheap, indistinguishable covers and. still haven't fixed it, or better yet, added the option for people to choose how their playlist covers are customized. It's 2025, these options for a streaming service this expensive should be common knowledge.

Jumped Amazon music because of the bugs and requirement to pay more money and it became buggy, now this is just as buggy and stops connecting randomly. Cleared all cookies and cache and I still can't play certain songs. It's like it freezes and I have to shut down the app and force close it running in the background. Highly inconvenient. Please fix.

Overall the app has improved over the last several years for Android. Main thing I'm looking for now is to add podcasts and/or audio books, to round up the ends that Spotify brings over Apple Music. If it weren't for audio quality being superior and having to reconfigure playlists I've had for quite a few years, I'd consider Spotify just to add podcasts & audio books to my access.... here's to hoping these could be new features on here sometime!

For being you know, *apple* music it's surprisingly good on android all things considered. Only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because it can be a bit buggy occasionally, sometimes only one song on albums will load or music won't play. Would love if some of those issues could be fixed but for the most part it's a good app.

I use this app every day! Can't function without it most days. Lol However, I only gave 4 starts because lately the app hasn't been working properly. I have to force stop it every time I open it or nothing will play. In addition to this, the photos for my playlists aren't displaying and whenever I exit the app to use a different one while listening to music it closes my playlist and goes to the search page. I thought this last update would have fixed all of that, but it hasn't.

When it comes to logging in, Apple just overdid the security. I can't login because I have no Apple devices and they keep saying they sent code to my trusted devices and I have only one trusted device. when I log in anywhere, they send sms, when I log into that phone, boom, they send code somewhere. this is bad. uninstalled it and won't resubscribe.

This app is incredibly difficult to work with for anyone on android. Yes the sound quality is good, theres a variety of music to chose from however it will frequently kick me off my account and my issue currently is my inability to play the next song unless it is skipped. Apple do better.

Great app, great music used it for a couple of months, but a few weeks ago it became unusable. Paid for subscription, but cannot use it at all - should be zero stars. It kicked me out without reason. Doesn't allow me to sign back in to my own account from my phone due to two factor identification not working for some reason and no other way available. Security over usability. Zero stars.

There is a glitch where the music I have searched in my history says it is not available in my region or country, but I can go to my library and play them. What is this? Also, the album art is still bugged, and in my collaborative playlists, next to my name is my supposed to be my set profile picture, but it is just my initials instead of my set profile picture, and my playlist covers don't load. Fix your bugs.

It's a good Music app, but for almost $20 a month I should not have to delete the app and re-download it for the music to start play Aka "Error 22950" and then after you re-download it for about 1-3 days it'll work and then hit you with the same error. This goes for downloaded music too. Not worth the trouble especially when they have the resources to fix the issue.

I have to say it is probably one of the best music apps I have used sound quality interface. All of it. The algorithm is way better than any others but they do throw in the occasional random song that is no where close to what I listen to. like not even in the ball park. Trent Reznor and dr dre from what I have heard created this app and apple purchased it from them. they also pay the artist better then most. from what the internet says. you know it has to be true if it's on the internet. ha

title: KakaoPage
description:
All Stories, One Place. KakaoPage
Discover immersive comics, novels, and booksâ€”all in one app.
Enjoy hit originals for free with Wait-Until-Free (WUF).
Plus, donâ€™t miss out on daily gifts of Cash and free Passes!

1. Exclusive Originals, Updated Daily

- Read original comics and novels updated daily.
- Access exclusive and early-release series for free or with WUF.
- Popular originals from KakaoPage and Kakao Webtoon, all in one place.

2. Wait-Until-Free for Comics, Novels & Books

- Only on KakaoPage! Enjoy popular titles for free.
- Look for titles with the clock icon.
- After you read one free episode, another free WUF Pass is issued after a set time.

3. Daily Surprises, Just for You

- Claim free Passes every day in the Gift Box.
- Watch out for daily surprise rewards!
- Check â€œCash Friendsâ€ to see how much free Cash you can get today. 


[Permissions Notice] 

â€¢ Optional Permissions
- Storage: To save or use photos/files on your device
- Notifications: To send you alerts from KakaoPage

* You can use the app without granting optional permissions.
In-app purchases available.

All Stories, One Place. KakaoPage
Discover immersive comics, novels, and booksâ€”all in one app.
Enjoy hit originals for free with Wait-Until-Free (WUF).
Plus, donâ€™t miss out on daily gifts of Cash and free Passes!

1. Exclusive Originals, Updated Daily

- Read original comics and novels updated daily.

summary: Join Kakao's K-contents platform for original comics, novels, and books!

scraped_reviews.content: The user interface is abhorrent beyond any other app I've before used. There are frequently crashes, and I've had to uninstall and reinstall sometimes just to get the app running. It's with much haste I've decided that it's simply not worth using or interacting with this ever again. I'd recommend the same for anyone who values their time

I came over from using the website and the app is really bad, the ui is horrible and convoluted and the top of the page are just ads and with pop-ups about paying for no ads, like, their just threatening the users with more ads now? and not only that its very hard to use outside Korea, the english translations can also use some work, and there are inconsistencies across the same works and sometimes mistakes in the manhwas too (not fully translated, translation error)

I wanted to like KakaoPage, but honestly, itâ€™s been a huge disappointment. The app feels cluttered, slow, and confusing to navigate. The biggest issue, though, is the payment model. The â€œfree to readâ€ system is misleading â€“ you constantly get stuck waiting for hours (or even days) just to unlock the next chapter, unless you spend money. And when you do pay, the prices are ridiculous for the amount of content you get. It feels more like a cash grab than a platform that respects its readers.

I finally went to try and use this app to officially support the authors but honestly the authors could've gotten more support if I were to make a direct contact with them. This app has way lower quality than it's officially advertised. The pages doesn't seem to load as fast as I expected it to be. The app occasionally crashes as well. Not to mention the comics are region-locked so even if you pay, you won't be able to read them. Overall, its a buggy app. I regret spending money here.

At first, I was excited to try Kakao but the app itself is a nightmare. It crashes randomly, loads super slowly, and sometimes my purchased chapters just wonâ€™t open. The layout is confusing, and it feels like they care more about pushing ads than making it easy to read. I wanted to enjoy the stories, but the app makes it so frustrating that I gave up halfway through.

The app has a lot of potential with its large library of comics and novels, but the overall user experience is very frustrating, especially for non-Korean users. It often crashes randomly, even on new phones, and loads very slowly. Sometimes purchased chapters donâ€™t even show up properly. On top of that, most of the content is locked behind a paywall, making it hard to enjoy. Overall, while the idea is good, the app itself is buggy, unreliable, and it's just so disappointing.

Kakao Page has potential, but the experience for non-Korean users is very frustrating. Even though there is a huge library of comics and novels, the lack of English support makes it almost unusable for international readers. The app frequently responds to user issues only in Korean, and there is no copy-paste feature for translating replies, which feels unhelpful. It's surprising that in 2025, the global version is still so limited.

The experience on Kakao page for non-Korean users is very frustrating. Even though there is a huge library of comics and novels, the lack of English support makes it almost unusable for international readers. The app frequently responds to user issues only in Korean, and there is no copy-paste feature for translating replies, which feels unhelpful. It's surprising that in 2025, the global version is still so limited.

Keeps logging me out randomly. Lost my progress twice already. Not worth the hassle. Notifications are buggy I either get spammed with the same alert ten times, or I donâ€™t get any at all. Payment went through but I never received a confirmation email. Had to contact my bank to reverse the charge. The app drains my battery faster than any other app I use. Needs serious optimization

Most of the content is locked behind a paywall, so unless youâ€™re willing to pay right away, itâ€™s hardly worth downloading. The nonstop ads make it frustrating to use, and there are far better platforms for reading my favorite comics without spending so much. On top of that, translations are limited since no other languages are available......

This is a completely misleading play store page. It's a global release, and the page is in English with the description saying, 'Enjoy stories in multiple languages'. Guess what? It's only available in Korean and whatever that other script language is. Just those two with no English option. If there's no English, then say so in the description. The reader itself isn't that bad, just basic, but where's the fullscreen mode? I don't want to see the notification bar while reading ðŸ˜®â€ðŸ’¨.

KakaoPage has a big library of webtoons and novels, but the app is frustrating to use. Many titles are blocked by region, translations are limited, and the confusing payment system quickly gets expensive. The app itself is unstableâ€”chapters fail to load, payments bug out, and support is slow. Mature content requires a Korean phone number for age verification, and offline reading doesnâ€™t really work. Overall, its flaws outweigh its potential.

Honestly, Karaoke Page is one of the worst manga reading apps I've tried. The interface is clunky and full of bugs & sometimes the pages don't load at all or just freeze halfway through. Ads pop up constantly, to the point where it ruins the reading flow. The translations are sloppy and often don't make sense, which makes it hard to enjoy the story. On top of that, many chapters are locked behind a ridiculous paywall system. This is unfortunately another money grab.

Not happy with it. No real value, sign up immediately forced me to pick Korean/Hindi. The reader works fine, but monetization is a mess. Collect/rent (pass) is a mess with EA style pricing to own each chapter. Solo Levelingâ€™s 197 chapters would be ~Â£62, AAA Game prices for digital pages. No regional pricing, unfair to weaker economies. Iâ€™ve heard artists arenâ€™t paid fairly either. Needs an all-you-can-read pass for 1 price e.g. Â£10 (like netflix) for any real value.

Iâ€™ve been using Kakao for a while, and honestly, itâ€™s been a frustrating experience. The app is overloaded with unnecessary features that make it feel cluttered instead of simple and user-friendly. Notifications donâ€™t always come through on time, and sometimes messages take forever to send, which completely defeats the purpose of a messaging app. On top of that, the app drains battery way too quickly compared to other messengers.

The app is a nightmare. It crashes randomly, loads super slowly, and sometimes my purchased chapters just won't open. The layout is confusing, and it feels like they care more about pushing ads than making it easy to read. I wanted to enjoy the stories, but the app makes it so frustrating that I gave up halfway through

This app is a total rip-off. Almost every single chapter is locked, and the so called â€œwait for freeâ€ system is just a scam it makes you wait forever, and by the time you finally get one chapter, youâ€™ve already lost interest. And donâ€™t even get me started on the prices. Paying for short chapters that end on cliffhangers feels like daylight robbery. On top of that, the app itself is buggy, lags a lot, and sometimes wonâ€™t even load properly. The worst part? So much content is region locked,

The app only works properly for sign up/login. If you installed this app trying to read stuff on it - good luck. Random freezes, pages unresponsive and some works are not even properly translated. Shame on you, KakaoPage, for releasing this slop that you call an app to the public, that too as a paid service. To anyone reading this - use WEBTOON by NAVER if you are into webtoons. Or buy the actual volume books. These guys don't deserve our money.

The app is incredibly buggy, even on recently reset phone. Combined with a bad UI and no dark mode (let me know if im wrong, but in my phone it doesn't follow system settings), it's just a pure mess. Not to mention the coin system that didn't even try to adjust regional pricing justly. Though initially coin seem not that expensive, we're talking about something that is constantly bought here

Really hate this app so hard to navigate through,can't even find the option to read in English. The ads are really annoying and everything is locked behind a paywall and have to wait for days just to read a single chapter for free I don't even know why that option even exists like just state it clearly that you want to force users to pay to enjoy reading the content

Honestly a very disappointing experience. The app is bloated, loads slowly, and often crashes in the middle of reading. Many titles are locked behind constant paywalls, and even after spending money, the pacing of chapter releases feels unfair. The interface is confusing, translations are inconsistent, and customer support is basically nonexistent when issues come up.

Honestly, Karaoke Page is one of the worst manga reading apps Iâ€™ve tried. The interface is clunky and full of bugs â€” sometimes the pages donâ€™t load at all or just freeze halfway through. Ads pop up constantly, to the point where it ruins the reading flow. The translations are sloppy and often donâ€™t make sense, which makes it hard to enjoy the story. On top of that, many chapters are locked behind a ridiculous paywall system. There are plenty of better manga/manhwa apps out there

DON'T Use this app! Source material wasn't translated properly, and unfortunately a money grab because of how much of the content is put behind a pay wall i.e "add cash" option. Free chapter every THREE hours, and having to pay $5 a chapter after the free ones. (usually 3) makes app expensive to use. UI is poor and honestly wouldn't recommend this app to anyone.

KakaoPage is a frustrating mess. The app lags, crashes often, and has a confusing interface. Navigation is awful, and translations are riddled with errors. In-app purchases are buggyâ€”charged for coins I didnâ€™t get, with slow, unhelpful support. Paywalls are steep, free content is scarce, and ads are intrusive. No offline reading and it drains battery fast. Save your moneyâ€”there are better webtoon/novel apps out there. 1 star, avoid this cash grab.

This is just awful. The Ui is a mess and completely nonsensical. They are behind on translating a plethora of different series. The picture quality on some of the series is terrible, with some images being outright blurry. Im not interested in buying from a company that is doing the bare minimum.

This app is extremely frustrating to use. Pages take forever to load, even with a strong internet connection, and half the time it freezes or crashes in the middle of reading. Iâ€™ve had to restart the app multiple times just to get through a single chapter. On top of that, navigation feels clunky and unresponsive.

I cannot in good conscience recommend this app because of the several critical issues plaguing Kakao. For an audience base that has an equally large English-speaking readers as it does Korean, this site lacks the support to accommodate the former. The UI is unintuitive and difficult to interact with, making a simple pastime now excruciating to engage with. Furthermore, the lack there of communication in possibly resolving these issues leads me to believe Kakao doesn't care, which is a shame.

English: Let's be honest, barely any English, bad translations, and a horrible login system. Also, don't get me started on the garbage page loading. It literally takes me 3 1/2 minutes to scroll 25% of a webtoon. This app is by all means ridiculous.

to sign up you have to agree to their terms of use and privacy policy but you can't see what it is, like can't you read it usually? they are asking for permission to access my device storage so least I expect is to transparently read what they have access to how they protect sensitive information but no you can't even read it, it feels like signing a contract without reading ,feels very wrongðŸ˜®â€ðŸ’¨

I really wanted to like this app, but itâ€™s been a frustrating experience from start to finish. The interface feels clunky and outdated, with constant lag and random crashes that make reading nearly impossible. Pages take forever to load, and sometimes they donâ€™t even load at all, leaving me staring at a blank screen. On top of that, the ads are way too aggressive.

One of the worst reader apps that exist. It's not pleasant to use, the localisation is lacking at best, and paying per chapter must be the worst payment system that exists. Buying physical copies of those that have it is a better option even. The company doesn't seem to understand nor care about interests or culture outside of Korea. Just avoid this app, or better, the company altogether.

The "pay-per-chapter" model can get very expensive, very quickly. While the "wait for free" system helps, itâ€™s a slow process for longer series. For frequent readers like me, this model feels less value driven compared to subscription services.

its the worst app to read. It randomly crashes. The loading so so so slow even though my wifi is fast. The pages bugs and some images get skipped or dont render. It takes a lot of internet like 50mb per chapter and it doesn't even load properly, if you refreshed it, it takes another 50mb again. worst app by far, will not recommend to anyone. Be safe from the horrible experience you will get from this app.

KakaoPage is really frustrating to use. The app lags a lot, the layout is confusing, and the payment system with cash/tickets just feels like a money trap. On top of that, tons of content is region-locked or not translated, so itâ€™s hard to enjoy. Wouldnâ€™t recommend.

I usually don't write reviews, but this app was so bad, I had to warn others. First of all, the ads are ridiculous! Every few seconds, an ad pops up, and itâ€™s not just a normal adâ€”itâ€™s one of those scammy "youâ€™ve won a prize!" type ads that try to trick you into clicking something. Itâ€™s honestly impossible to enjoy the app because of it. On top of that, the quality of the app itself is awful. It crashes all the time, and the features donâ€™t work as advertised. Itâ€™s like they donâ€™t even care abou

The app has great stories, but the experience is frustrating. Translations are often poor and feel unedited. The pay-per-chapter model is expensive, with unclear pricing, and the â€œfree waitâ€ system is unreliable. The interface is clunky and hard to navigate, with frequent bugs and crashes. Overall, it feels more focused on profit than providing a smooth reading experience.

I downloaded it and bought some coins to read the latest chapter of my fav. I managed to read one chapter and i closed the app, came back and i can't log in. what's happening? i logged in again, my coins are gone. i have two chapters unlocked in a story i never read. I never bought those chapters, i never read that manhwa. my coins are gone.

the experience of the app is okay. I thought of supporting then i remembered the news where they forced laboured one of the artist until she had a miscarriage, but allowed her supervisor to take leaves. So that left me in a very bad taste. The pricing is also somewhat predatory. Not recommended.

worst app to read manga, doesn't even have many mangas. and what do you mean I have to use points which could only be obtained through money for early access, that's just like "pay to win" type. Don't install. Also they badmouth any website/app that was greater than them but was eventually shutdown just like "Comick".

This app is an amazing display of incompetence. First of all they are so lazy that they don't even bother translating most of the interface to English. Really. in 2025 where anyone can use Google translate. Then upload to global market for what?? The app itself is buggy and keeps crashing, limited content in English and worst of all if u buy coins it can disappear and the CS team won't help you like they really can't be bothered. Download at your own risk!!

This is the worst app ever. It doesnâ€™t even have English language translations, which is unacceptable. These big corporations canâ€™t be bothered to hire a proper English translator, yet theyâ€™ll spend money taking down small websites that provide accurate translations, even when those sites give credit to the original.

This app is a straight-up scam. The paywall is insane, and for what? The translations arenâ€™t even goodâ€”if youâ€™re gonna charge that much, at least make the product worth it. Instead, theyâ€™re just trying to monopolize everything, killing a lot of series from other platforms. It feels less like they want to host manhwa and more like they want to bury everything while squeezing money out of readers. Honestly, itâ€™s a greedy, anti-reader mess and a complete disappointment.

Aside from being a buggy mess, the translations is too slow for something that is supposed to be a paid service. It is better to just use other services than this one, I will never recommend this to anyone serious about reading Manhwa's or anything at all, just support the author from other means if that's your reason.

I would have given zero stars if I could. How money-hungry do these people need to be to make an app this utterly useless? The UI is an absolute disasterâ€”clunky, confusing, and frustrating to use. The search option is a complete joke; unless you type the exact name perfectly, it shows no entries found. And then, on top of this mess, they actually have the audacity to ask us to pay for it. What a scam.

If I could give this app zero stars, I would. It's an absolute nightmare. The app is slow, buggy, and the translations are absolute trash. On top of that, the entire system is a blatant cash grab with constant paywalls. Don't waste your time or money on this frustrating experience.

As a huge fan of webtoons, I was excited to support the official release of my favourite series. Unfortunately, the experience has been a letdown. The official translations on KakaoPage are often weeks, sometimes months, behind the original Korean release. By the time a chapter is officially translated, I've already seen spoilers everywhere online.

I honestly expected better from KakaoPage, but using this app has been nothing short of a headache. On the surface, it looks polished, but once you actually spend time here, the problems show up fast. The system of points and coupons feels intentionally confusing, almost as if the goal is to drain money rather than provide a fair reading experience. Stories are locked so quickly that it feels less like entertainment and more like a trap. Such a shame app lol.

I was able to login in the app before and bought some coins, uninstalled the app after because I prefer using the browser because it translated to English language. However, I cant seem to login now. i tried to reset the password but its saying my email cant be found. TF!!

The app is horrid in it's design, lacks translations for anyone who isn't Korean and riddled with bugs. Then it goes to have the gaul to bombard you with ads 24/7. No one should be expected to pay for this when not even most of the things you wish to read is not there. Then it's staff is rude to its audience, 0/10 do not download.

sure you can take down the pirate websites. but, you should keep yourself in check as making fun of what a ton of people used is just bad thinking. And everything in this app is hidden by micro transactions or just outright payment just to deliver the bare minimum. If you're going to make fun of pirate websites make sure you're delivering quality content for the amount you're asking for.

title: TextNow: Call + Text Unlimited
description:
Call and text for free with TextNow, the free phone service with over 100 million users. Get nationwide coverage with unlimited talk and text, plus 5G dataâ€”starting at $0/month. Staying connected doesnâ€™t have to be expensive.

What makes us different?

â€¢ No phone bill, no fixed contracts, and no hidden fees
â€¢ Get a free local phone number or keep your own for a private second line or business use.
â€¢ Flexible data options: daily, weekly, or monthly unlimited data access.
â€¢ Low-cost international calling to 230+ countries

FREE TALK & TEXT NATIONWIDE: NO PHONE BILL, NO FIXED CONTRACTS

Stay connected with the TextNow free Wi-Fi calling and texting app, or order a TextNow SIM card to freely call, text, and use selected apps without having to connect to Wi-Fi.

FREE FLEX PLAN

We are the first phone service provider to offer data completely FREE. With the Free Flex Plan, you can access apps like:

â€¢ Email
â€¢ Maps
â€¢ Rideshare
â€¢ Banking apps

All without paying for a data plan. Simply order a SIM card to get started - No commitments, no hidden fees.

UNLIMITED DATA PLANS: AFFORDABLE & FLEXIBLE

Only pay for the data you use with no long-term contracts or commitments.

Weâ€™re the ONLY provider with super flexible unlimited data options.

We have:
â€¢ Low-cost daily passes
â€¢ Affordable weekly or monthly unlimited data plans

You can cancel any time in the app! Get the data you want, exactly when you want it.

SECOND PHONE NUMBER: FOR PRIVATE CALLING & TEXTING, A SEPARATE BUSINESS LINE & MORE

Use the TextNow calling and text messaging app as a free second phone line. Perfect for 2nd line, business phone, side hustles, or personal use. It gives free calls and texts without an extra phone bill.

INTERNATIONAL CALLING: Low-cost across 230+ COUNTRIES

Have friends and family overseas? TextNow offers free calls to Mexico and Canada with low-cost international calls to 230+ countries with rates starting at less than $0.01 per minute.

WHY TEXTNOW?

â€¢ Call and text for free immediately when you download the TextNow communication app â€“ No bill or fees
â€¢ Get nationwide data coverage with a TextNow SIM card, and talk and text without Wi-Fi
â€¢ Get a local phone number or keep your existing number. Area codes are available across most metro areas in the US.
â€¢ FREE voice call, direct message, SMS message, picture and video messenger to the US or Canada.
â€¢ Flexible data options with daily, weekly, and monthly. Only pay when you want it.
â€¢ Use on multiple devices including your computer or tablet and effortlessly access calls and texts whenever you need them.
â€¢ Low-cost international calls across over 230 countries.
â€¢ Voicemail to text audio transcription and conference calling.

HOW IS TEXTNOW FREE?

There are no yearly or monthly fees to use TextNow. We partner with brands to pay for your phone service (so you donâ€™t have to) with in-app ads. Ads wonâ€™t interrupt your experience. If you don't like ads, you can purchase a subscription to remove them.

MORE FEATURES STANDARD FOR ALL USERS

â€¢ Passcode for safe and private texting and calling
â€¢ Caller ID
â€¢ Customizable free text tones, call tones, ringtones, vibrations and phone backgrounds
â€¢ Quick Reply to speedily respond to friends
â€¢ A home screen widget for instant use
â€¢ Text from your computer and seamlessly synchronize with your mobile device via textnow.com

So, what are you waiting for? Download the app and take control of your phone service, starting today.

Follow us on social for the latest news and offers:
TikTok - @textnow
Facebook - @textnow
Instagram - @textnow
Twitter - @TextNow

Privacy policy: https://www.textnow.com/privacy
Terms of use: https://www.textnow.com/terms
