title: Elevate - Brain Training Games
description: Elevate is an award-winning brain trainer that uses fun games and brain teasers to improve vocabulary, speaking abilities, processing speed, memory skills, mental math, and more for adults and students. Each person gets a personalized learning program that adjusts over time to maximize results. The more you play Elevate, the more you'll improve practical cognitive skills with engaging brain teasers that boost productivity, earning power, and self-confidence. Over 90% of users notice improvements in vocabulary, memory, math skills, and overall mental sharpness by regularly engaging with our games and exercises. Elevate is designed to test and enhance cognitive abilities, making it a great educational tool. No matter your age, background, or profession, you can benefit from our app through daily practice. Elevate offers a 7-day free trial and a free version. Sign up, then tap the X in the top left corner to use the free version. IN THE NEWS â€œElevate comes out aheadâ€ in the battle of the brain training apps. - CNET Elevate is a â€œcognitive pick-me-upâ€ with games that are â€œgood for mental breaks throughout the workday.â€ - Washington Post FEATURES 40+ Brain Training Games: Improve cognitive skills like vocabulary, focus, memory, processing, math, grammar, precision, and comprehension with 40+ brain training games and puzzles for adults and students. Performance Tracking: Measure your performance in language and problem-solving against yourself and others. Weekly reports highlight your key accomplishments and learning opportunities. Personalized Workouts: Customize the focus of your daily workouts to train and practice the mind skills you need most. Select from diverse tests, games, and puzzles to stay sharp, increase focus, and build cognitive skills. Adaptive Progression: Engage in math and word games that evolve in difficulty as you progress, ensuring a fun and challenging experience that tests and hones your concentration, language, and logical problem-solving abilities. Workout Achievements: Start a workout streak with our brain trainer app and stay motivated with 150+ achievements to win while you train your mind. WHY ELEVATE Expand your vocabulary with brain teasers. Learn how to use thousands of new words through fun games and puzzles for adults and students. Express yourself more effectively by honing your grammar skills and learning to write with clarity and persuasiveness. Improve your spelling, punctuation, and grammar. Avoid common writing pitfalls with regular practice. Become a better reader and learner. Easily understand language, improve concentration, and logically flow through everyday materials faster. Solve everyday math problems quickly and easily. Improve your problem-solving abilities for comparing prices, splitting bills, and calculating discounts. Boost your focus and memory skills. Get shopping lists out of your pocket and into your mind. Never forget to buy the milk you need or the chocolate you've been craving. Speak confidently with strong grammar. Advance your speech with new vocabulary words. Become more articulate and develop clear expression and tone. Feel mentally sharper as an adult. Continue to learn with Elevate's proven language and logical problem-solving training program. Elevate's brain games, puzzles, and teasers are created with educational experts based on proven educational learning techniques. Our brain trainerâ€™s mental workout algorithms draw from cognitive research in attention, memory studies, and logical reasoning, providing exercises that test and enhance focus and memory skills through deliberate practice. 93% of people who use Elevate frequently feel mentally sharper and more confident in key skills, proving the educational value of our program. For more details, see our Terms of Service (https://www.elevateapp.com/terms) and Privacy Policy (https://www.elevateapp.com/privacy).

summary: Train your cognitive skills with fun math, word, grammar, vocab & memory puzzles

scraped_reviews.content: This app is excellent for sharpening your linguistic and mathematical skills! I really enjoy the games, workouts, and overall format of the app. Premium is absolutely worth it. My only complaint is that there are still some features that are locked even after purchasing premium, and all the memory games require audio which makes them a little inconvenient. I also wish there was a way to practice your saved words in a flashcard format. Still a great and educational app that is worth premium!!!

I really liked it for about two weeks, but now I regret purchasing the yearly premium version. It has become quite boring. You play the same games over and over again. I find the timed aspect of the games to be frustrating, leading to unnecessary mistakes. I am someone who is able to process information quickly, but I don't do it well under pressure, nor do I feel that speed equals intelligence. I would rather be accurate than lightning fast.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback! We'll share this with the rest of the Elevate team for further consideration as we make future updates to the app. You may prefer choosing a Zen workout, which allows you to play without the timer. If you have any further questions about accessing the various workouts, email us anytime at support@elevateapp.com!

scraped_reviews.content: There needs to be some geography, history etc. Should be teaching periodic table, things like that too but this only teaches reading and math. The way they make you enter your answers for some of the math is really annoying you can't just type in a number it makes you add stacks of 10s, 5s, 1s. Very easy to get a wrong answer that way. And "which part of the sentence is too wordy" I don't like that exercise. Depends on what I am writing perhaps I want to describe something in depth.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback! We'll share this with the rest of the Elevate team for further consideration as we update the app. If you have any further questions or any thoughts on how we can improve our app, email us anytime at support@elevateapp.com!

scraped_reviews.content: Seems cool, but could use improvements. For instance, all memory categorized games require sound, so I can't improve my score until I can play somewhere that I can turn on sound. Not to mention, they won't help deaf or hard if hearing people. Second, the daily crossword was the same puzzle, which is not encouraging when I've only played two "days" (really just one day before and after midnight). Last, but not least, the icons for the games are general symbols, so you can't identify specific game

What an exceptional game. This was very well-thought out. The progression in difficulty as you level up is applied in very small doses, but it's noticeable. For me, it keeps the fire burning to learn. This game tests you in Speaking, Writing, Memory, Reading, and Math. The way this game builds and utilizes your cognitive function is a godsend to your brain. If you're gonna sit on your phone for hours every day, you might as well use it to better your mental capabilities.

Solid app, good options. Free version is robust. The 3/5 is due to the emphasis on the visual design over focus. If you have ADHD good luck because your focus is all over the place with swirling and circles and shapes and shadows. Distractions abound yet the games are timed and reward you for speed and correct first answers. A good example is the Percentage exercise where you are trying to do one math problem but see other answers under the current one as well as shapes.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback! We'll share this with the rest of the Elevate team for further consideration as we make future updates to the app. If you have any further questions or any thoughts on how we can improve our app, email us anytime at support@elevateapp.com!

scraped_reviews.content: I'm in the 5th year of my subscription. Great exercises focused on improving practical skills that keep you sharp in your professional and personal life. The app is super stable and has had no issues whatsoever on 4 different phones. Kudos to the dev team. I do wish they'd add new exercises more often. There's only been a handful in as many years.

I love this app, this is the only brain game app I went out on a limb and purchased a subscription for.. I love it and think it's worth the money. I do hope more games are added and maybe a competitive option but so far I have been training everyday and know my math skills have leveled up so I believe all my other skills are sharpening as well. would recommend and renew! my only other qualm is having to wait for the score to load after the game on the graph chart! hope more features are added!

Been playing the free version for over a year. Recent update means there's now an ad after your 3 free games. I understand the need for that, but I CANNOT CLOSE THE AD, even when it's finished playing. There is no X, and hitting the back button on my phone doesn't work. I have to just close the app, which means I can't see my daily summary and streak anymore. Very annoying, so much so that I'm considering deleting the app if they don't fix that.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! Thank you for your constructive feedback about the addition of ads on the free version of the app. We're sorry to hear you're having trouble exiting the ad after it finishes. Please reach out to us at support@elevateapp.com, and we'll be happy to look into this further.

scraped_reviews.content: Love it! ðŸš€ðŸ”¥ðŸ†âš¡ðŸ’¯ Free version alone allows 3 exercises a day (choose between two options for each). Allow notifications to be reminded. As someone into self-improvement, it can be a real help when you're in a lull. It's been immensely helpful. Really enjoy it. Unsure if the paid version is worth it, my luck I'd pay and then not engage with it anymore than I already am - but actually considering. No, they're not paying me to say this, and I rarely, if ever, leave reviews - positive at that.

Now they got ads at the end of the game, before you see your scores. Sometimes you're able to skip it but sometimes it makes you go to the Google Play app, (like if you're actually downloading whatever was offered) to be able to go back to the game, and the whole thing is long and tedious! Fix that, please!! Old review: I love the free version of Elevate. I've been using it for years to keep my brain active. I'm sure the paid version is worth it. I just don't have time to play for so long.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback! We'll share this with the rest of the Elevate team for further consideration as we make future updates to the app. If you have any further questions or any thoughts on how we can improve our app, email us anytime at support@elevateapp.com!

scraped_reviews.content: It costs too much for what it is. They do offer a one time fee, but it is exorbitant for what you are getting, some simple games that are easy to create that you play over and over again with no real changes. I would buy it if it was $20, or maybe even $30, but $400?!? No way!! And I will NEVER buy something that charges me a monthly fee. The free option has ads, but they are the most annoying ads I have ever seen and it is severely limited, so I will uninstall this and look elsewhere.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your helpful feedback about our app and our pricing! We often offer promotions, discounts, or special pricing to help with the cost. If you have any more questions or would like us to check on your payment options, email us at support@elevateapp.com

scraped_reviews.content: the app is pretty good with many choices for learning, expanding. and fortifying knowledge and skills to thinking. Yet the major downfall of it is if you want better access the cost annually is a bit much , and "lifetime" is absolutely absurd. enjoyed the 7 day trial but dont think ill continue with how many adds and how limited free is.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback about our app and our pricing! We often offer promotions, discounts, or special pricing to help with the cost. If you have any more questions or would like us to check on your payment options, email us at support@elevateapp.com.

scraped_reviews.content: Used to love this app so much. Was using the free version for a year, but suddenly with the last update now there are ads in the app that aren't easy to dismiss and no timer to run out. I have to exit the app and restart it in order to see my xp after the third free game. Really annoyed with this latest development, could at least make it easier to exit out of the ad when the minimum time has passed.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback! We'll share this with the rest of the Elevate team for further consideration as we make future updates to the app. If you have any further questions or any thoughts on how we can improve our app, email us anytime at support@elevateapp.com.

scraped_reviews.content: I find the games are frustratingly ableist. Most scores are based on a combination of accuracy, speed, dexterity and focus; whether those criteria are relevant or not. As a result, a learner with physical or visual issues can expect to have perpetually inferior scores, regardless of their working knowledge. Overall, I get how this app would benefit individuals who don't need accommodations. Sadly, those of us who need accessibility features will never reap as many rewards.

I was thinking about purchasing to keep my mind sharp, but wanted to try it for a while first. free version you can only play 3 games per day for about 20 seconds each. I play my 3 every day. played yesterday so today it pops up that I had a steak freeze (my last one) yesterday.... but I know I played and that's the 2nd time its done that. After that it will take away all the days you've played starting you back at 1 unless you purchase streak freeze. I won't purchase with those errors
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! We're sorry to hear that you're experiencing an issue with Elevate! Please contact us at support@elevateapp.com and tell us youâ€™re from Google reviews so we can find out more about the issue and assist you. Thanks for your patience!

scraped_reviews.content: This app is phenomenal with reading, math, memory, etc etc... however, the amount of stuff you get without paying for a subscription is absolutely insane. Everyday, I play the three daily challenge things, and only get one game that changes weekly. THATS IT. Its extremely dissapointing. Im glad that the stuff is helpful, but jesus christ you do not have to make it that limited.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for mentioning this. We would love to learn more about your experience. Would you mind reaching out to support@elevateapp.com so we can put you directly in touch with our team? Thanks in advance for your help; we appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: It's a great brain training app. Unfortunately, recently "Leagues" were introduced, which automatically shows your profile in a leaderboard with other players after every training you do. As a user with the sole goal of self-improvement, this is a detractor from the overall experience. Why am I being forced to participate in this multi-player gamification attempt? Please provide your users with a way to opt out. And no, the option to make your profile private is not a replacement for opting-out.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback! We'll share this with the rest of the Elevate team for further consideration as we make future updates to the app. If you have any further questions or any thoughts on how we can improve our app, email us anytime at support@elevateapp.com!

scraped_reviews.content: Excellent app with fun games for anyone, but, especially for people with ADHD. I'm improving everything from memory and focus to vocabulary and grammar and even math. There is even a game that helps me to remember people's names! That has always been a problem for me. I highly recommend this app. Do the daily quiz with your coffee in the morning to get your mind working. I became addicted to the synonyms game! I just love learning new words and trying to beat my own score.

I love this app. unfortunately, I can't afford the full payments. But the limited version is still a challenge that we humans crave. Well done devs, well done, indeed ðŸ‘.You get to play only one game. But you can play that one game all day. It may be worth the annual price. I just feel like their teasing us. I'm already addicted. I start university soon, and I feel it's a plus for an English major. Also, the Magoosh language app is great. The monthly price is great. I'm going to buy the $4.99

I've been using this app for a while and enjoying it. I play every day faithfully and did purchase the $50 annual subscription. For those that are new to this game or thinking about trying it? Be aware of their rule about missing a day or two! I played this game daily for months and logged on yesterday to find my 140 DAYS OF PLAYING was reduced to DAY 1 ??? I haven't missed a day! There's NO REASON they put me back to DAY 1 ? I'm so DISAPPOINTED!! Beware of their tricks and deception!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! We're sorry to hear that you're experiencing an issue with your streak! Please contact us at support@elevateapp.com and tell us youâ€™re from Google reviews so we can find out more about the issue and assist you. Thanks for your patience!

scraped_reviews.content: I was recommended to this app for cognitive stimulation following concussion treatment by Drs. I liked the free version in 2021. I could play the 3 games of the day. Now, after the initial "workout," I can only play the game of the week. Also, the number of different games allowed on the free version was reduced. An older version had more variety for the daily workout. Now, I only get those games if I am willing to pay the high cost. My post-concussive brain can't handle the flashing colors.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback about the free version of Elevate! We'll share this with our team for future consideration as we make improvements to the app. If you have any additional questions or feedback, please reach out to us at support@elevateapp.com.

scraped_reviews.content: It's good, but I've played for months and here are the major issues: 1) the difficulty doesn't increase fast enough. 2) the types of games aren't varied enough. 3) I'd consider subscribing but you don't show the games available under the categories mentioned: memory retention, focus, math... If it's only the games I've been exposed to so far, it's just not worth it, but if there are others, you should market that as motivation to purchase.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your kind and helpful feedback about our app and our pricing! We often offer promotions, discounts, or special pricing to help with the cost. We also offer a free version of the app: www.elevateapp.com/free. If you have any more questions or would like us to check on your payment options, email us at support@elevateapp.com!

scraped_reviews.content: I have trouble concentrating and retaining information due to auditory delay syndrome and ADHD. when I'm paying attention, the challenge of the game is thrilling. My problem, I often press the wrong button by accident and yell, Noooooo I had the answer! Sometimes I get lost with the speed of each game, and get frustrated. I'm hoping my focus improves over time. all in all, good stuff!

UPDATE: I've been using this app for at least a couple years now and here are my thoughts. My mental math skills have improved. For example, I'm quick to figure out what the new price of something is marked down. I've also learned some fun facts while doing some of the trainings. Lastly, my grammar is slightly better. I want to believe it has long term benefits though such as helping to keep my mind sharp and stop memory loss with aging.

I've just got it and I already enjoy it, It's games are very fluid and understandable. And it offers the competitive edge that makes me even more enveloped in this game. Though it has huge flaws, Like, as others have probably mentioned, it's locked behind a huge pay wall. You get three games and some development stats. that's it. if they gave me even a little more access to things without having to pay. it'd be a easy bump to 5 stars. (btw it's 10 $ monthly and 40 $ yearly. lifetime =400$)

Looks cool, but it's crazy expensive. I've never seen a $400 app in the app store. I miss when you could buy the best apps for $3-10. Now it's $10/month or 400 to buy! Update: on day 2, I was offered 50% off. I signed up for a year at $20. Lifetime is "only" 200 with the discount, but there are very few apps Ive used more than 2 years, and they are all utilities like Waze or Gmail, not a "game". If still using it regularly in a few years, then I'll consider lifetime.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your helpful feedback! The price you're referring to is our lifetime membership. We also offer a monthly and annual subscription option. We often have promotions, discounts, or special pricing to help with the cost. If you have any more questions or want us to check your payment options, email us at support@elevateapp.com!

scraped_reviews.content: I love the concept and its fun. There are issues, they have some vocab and synonyms wrong, and they ignore expressive uses. They are awful at definitions. Many words defined incorrectly. Nice app, but doesn't cater to creative thinking. They need to review words in the catalogue to ensure they are matching in implementation. It's very nitpicky. It also doesn't teach. It just trains you to play the game.

Love this app and the short daily exercises to improve myself. I ended up going with the subscription, because it is worth it! Only thing I would change is- I noticed there is a section for "speaking", but it is actually just reading, writing, and spelling- no speaking necessary! I am already a great reader and writer, but would love improvement in speaking. Please offer games to actually improve speech, by speaking into the microphone- not just reading!

I just started this game! It does not require a lot of time to go through lessons, as well it is engaging and beneficial for the mind in many aspects of grammar, reading content, language, mathematics. I highly recommend this to anyone of all ages above a Second Grade Level. ~I have been teaching K-8th grades for over 30+ yrs. Thought I would try it outðŸ˜‰

I think it's great and I can totally see how it could teach people to be more advanced in certain subjects. i like it. if i had cash i would get the full Elevate experience, but i don't. but they still have the free version for poor people like myself. poor people will only get three subjects to advance in writing math and percentages or something. people with money could learn a lot more. it's fun to me.

runï¼it is fun in the beginning, and i found i barely use it. This app is very difficult to unsubscribe. It is not clear that your trial is about to end, i thought it is two week and very difficilt to find cancel button. The customer service refused to refund because you cannot request refund after one month(just a couple days over because i cannot find the cancellation method), even you agree to pay for the month used. They will just tell you 'oh sorry, because you didn't read the agreement'
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. Refunds can be requested if within 30 days of the purchase date, in line with Google Play Store policy. If you have any further questions or any thoughts on how we can improve our app, email us anytime at support@elevateapp.com.

scraped_reviews.content: I love the app. I really do. But the teaser exercises before you purchase the membership are a little irritating . they're either too repetitive or not enough of them to thirst for the whole thing. im not an expert in explaining or coming up for the solution to this obvious speed bump for the content creators , but something needs to be done . maybe a psychologist is needed to implement the right amount of teasers ; the right amount of days to trigger the customer. I don't know.

Be Wary it seems like it has potential but this is not a free app. it gives you a free 3-7 day trial, then starts a subscription plan that bills whatever information you have on your play store. if you do try it out, just remember to cancel your subscription. this is quite unfortunate. I was really looking forward to using an app like this, but I don't want to pay a subscription. maybe if it was $5.00 one time purchase fee. cant say anything about the puzzles I didnt go past subscription screen
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We offer both a 7-day trial that can be canceled at any time and a completely free version of Elevate. Hereâ€™s a tutorial: www.elevateapp.com/free. If you were charged or if you have any more questions, email us at support@elevateapp.com, tell us you're from Google reviews, and we can help you!

scraped_reviews.content: I enjoy the games on this app, However everything is locked behind a paywall. You get three games that are free, and I think that some of the sentences on the remove a word game are AI generated. The leagues are paywalled since you need to play four games. I really wanted to do more with this app, but the majority of it is locked. It had the opportunity to be a great game, I would rather have ads than this awful paywall! Don't download this unless you're willing to pay!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback about the free version of Elevate! We'll share this with our team for future consideration as we make improvements to the app. If you have any additional questions or feedback, please reach out to us at support@elevateapp.com.

scraped_reviews.content: I have enjoyed using the app, but I am getting annoyed with reminders about losing my streaks on the app. I honestly couldn't care less about my status with streaks. I'm trying to use the app mindfully and the apps' focus on streaks is not aligned with my personal goals. I enjoy challenging myself and learning, but give it a rest with the focus on streaks..

BE ADVISED: Free trial is ONLY for annual plan, not monthly. I was charged for the app even though I canceled before what I thought my free trial was over, but they got back to me and had it refunded. Prompt and good customer service. The app is also great too. plan to get it again when I have more disposable income.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! If youâ€™re experiencing a billing concern, please email us at support@elevateapp.com and mention that youâ€™re reaching out from Google reviews. Weâ€™ll be happy to look into it for you.

scraped_reviews.content: Only doing the free version but really enjoying it. Considering upgrading to allow access to further games. It's relatively easy so far but I want to improve answering under quick fire... trying to reduce midlife brain fog and lack of sharpness. Think it will get harder, can be tailored to the needs of the individual. (possibly more so in the paid version). Currently on reduced price offer if anyone is interested Â£20 annually. Only on day 3 but enjoying it so far.

The games are a good mental exercise, especially as a way to break out of down time or get going in the morning while drinking coffee. An improvement I would like to see is a feedback option that doesn't require exiting to compose an email. When I think a given answer is wrong, it's frustrating and makes me feel the game is inherently unfair. Like how soon isn't a synonym for impending, frustratingly wrong edit: check a dictionary, devs, rather than try to gaslight people
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback about this! It may help to know that only adjectives are accepted in the Synonyms game. Creating a way to submit feedback directly in the app is a great suggestion. In the meantime, please feel free to reach out to us anytime at support@elevateapp.com.

scraped_reviews.content: So far, so good! I have the same issue with this game as I do other logic/reasoning puzzles: there are times when you have to be in the mind of the puzzle writer to understand what they're trying to get you to say. I have gotten things "wrong" when one connotation of the word could easily relate to the option I chose, but they were looking for a different (still correct) connotation. Fortunately, I find this to be a minor con inherent in puzzles and like the app overall!

Update 12/28/24. Used the paid version for a solid year and sadly at the end the road. Will uninstall and find something else. The memory content is repetitive. While the supposed difficulty level increases, I keep getting the exact same content over and over. It's dishonest. It helped me a lot, but they just didn't care enough to add content beyond a few months of daily use. I outgrew it. Contacted them multiple times, but no changes. It's a shame because I liked the app a lot.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. We apologize for any frustration and appreciate your candid feedback about our Memory content. We'll share this with the rest of the Elevate team for further consideration as we make future updates to the app. If you have any further questions or any thoughts on how we can improve our app, email us anytime at support@elevateapp.com!

scraped_reviews.content: The games are mostly engaging and satisfying. I really do feel like my math skills could improve. I take issue with some of the games, though. In writing, the best way to express a thought is often a matter of opinion. I feel as though the games Clarity and Brevity seek to remove any unique "voice" a speaker may have and frequently dumb down a sentence. I find them unhelpful. Another, Association, may present a word that could be argued two ways. I like the word of the day. May subscribe later.

So far I am enjoying the app, I can't really tell if the games are helping 'train my brain' yet, but it's a good time killer that helps my brain wake up in the morning. With that said, I think the pricing of this app is where it loses me. It IS possible to avoid signing up for the free trial and continue as a a free user, but your usage of the app is very limited. A 14 day [2 week] trial period is very short, and $40/year is far too much in my opinion for what amounts to a mobile game.

I really enjoy Elevate! You can only play three games daily without paying, unfortunately. I wouldn't mind buying a premium version if it had a one-time, reasonable charge such as other apps have (most are under $10 on the Play Store). However, paying $5 a month for as long as I use it is not something I'm willing to do, because that could really add up. Other than that issue, it's a great app.

It isn't really doing anything for anyone, it's just quizzing you on the same criteria over and over. You get "better" because you start to memorize the answers and can answer them more quickly, thus inflating your score. But that does not equal higher cognitive ability. It just means your brain is adapting to their criteria. You need to have a truly novel experience every single time, otherwise it's not doing anything.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. We're sorry to hear you did not enjoy Elevate. If you have any further questions or any thoughts on how we can improve our app, email us anytime at support@elevateapp.com!

scraped_reviews.content: I really love this app, but I have noticed a glitch or 2. Eg; In brevity, there could be multiple correct answers. These are expected in any game so no biggie. Just hope you guys can keep them to a minimum. What I really want to see is another category or 2 relating to general knowledge. Science, Geography, etc would be great. Writing & reading seem a bit redundant and could be consolidated imo. But overall, it's a great app to keep you sharp.

Of course they try to sell you a better version, but the free version is cool. It gives me a few mins of fun and trying to see if I can beat yesterday's score. Sign in, then when it asks what plan you want to pay for, you just skip it (press back button) and viola! Free version to play daily. I love trying to do things faster and better... it is a fun game.

The stats are set up to have you begin with lower scores. Instructions in the first game are not clear, leaving you to figure out how to play the brain game, resulting in incorrect answers, loss in time, or both. You, therefore, get lower scores to start. Designed to make you "think" you're improving, when really you just eliminate the crutch. Predatory app.

I really have liked adding this to my morning routine. I have definitely noticed that doing math in my head is easier, and just using my brain has helped with other parts of my life, such as concentration and generally just using my poor brain! I agree that some of the exercises like brevity just turns the sentence into a more boring one. Yes, it is more concise, but sometimes giving a more dramatic effect is important.

It's a really good app, but 90% of it, you need to buy a subscription to get. I downloaded the screen to help with my Grammer, memory and overall everything they teach. But I could even use the app for 10 minutes before seeing that there's only like 4 things you can do for free. "40+ games" they said more like 40+ games that require subscriptions -_- I hate the fact that there's no good apps that give education, but are actually free. Don't waste your timeðŸ˜
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback about the free version of Elevate! We'll share this with our team for future consideration as we make improvements to the app. If you have any additional questions or feedback, please reach out to us at support@elevateapp.com.
